articles.description: All the latest transfer news and updates with just a few days to go before the first window of the summer comes to an end.
articles.title: Transfer news LIVE: Updates with days remaining in the first window

articles.description: Follow live text and BBC radio commentary of the French Open men's singles semi-finals at Roland-Garros - Carlos Alcaraz v Lorenzo Musetti and Jannik Sinner v Novak Djokovic.
articles.title: French Open 2025 LIVE: Sinner vs Djokovic - scores & radio from Roland Garros

articles.description: Ange Postecoglou is sacked as Tottenham manager 16 days after leading them to victory in the Europa League final.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou: Tottenham boss leaves 16 days after Europa League triumph

articles.description: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz moves into the French Open final after Italian opponent Lorenzo Musetti retires injured in their semi-final.
articles.title: French Open 2025 results: Carlos Alcaraz through to men's final after Lorenzo Musetti retires injured

articles.description: Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins withdraws from the England squad with a minor injury.
articles.title: Ollie Watkins withdraws from England squad with minor injury

articles.description: As Tottenham begin the search for Ange Postecoglou's managerial successor, BBC Sport look at some of the possible candidates.
articles.title: Tottenham's manager candidates: Andoni Iraola, Thomas Frank, Marco Silva, Edin Terzic, Mauricio Pochettino

articles.description: Former England captain David Beckham is set to be awarded a knighthood in King Charles' birthday honours.
articles.title: David Beckham set to be awarded knighthood in King Charles' birthday honours list

articles.description: Five-time Olympic champion Sir Bradley Wiggins says he's "indebted" to disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong, saying that he has been a "great strength and inspiration".
articles.title: Sir Bradley Wiggins: Lance Armstrong an 'inspiration' for British former cyclist

articles.description: Twenty years since the Glazer family bought Manchester United BBC Verify has found £1.2bn has been spent on debt interest, debt repayments, dividends and fees to the family.
articles.title: How the Glazer family cost Manchester United £1.2bn
